alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 19 at 4:14PM MDT until June 19 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Sheridan County in north central Wyoming... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 413 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 17 miles north of Powder River Rest Area, or 24 miles east of Buffalo, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Clearmont, Leiter and Arvada. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
